title: Use case - VMware vCenter Capsule
content:
Mark Tyler, a developer, wants to deploy a virtual machine. Mark has to subscribe to a VMware vCenter service offering through the Service Portal. He can go to the Service Portal, browse for the offering, and request it.

For the VMware vCenter offering to be available in the Service Portal, the administrator should use the VMware vCenter capsule and make use of the service design, publish and configure it.

Personas

The following table shows the personas involved in getting the VMware vCenter cloud offering in the Service Portal:

Persona Responsibilities

Sandra - Suite administrator

Configure tenant and enable Design and Deploy (DND) capability

Oliver Twist - Tenant Administrator

Administer tenant and configure user authorization

Add Aggregation Provider

Ray Smith - DND Administrator

Create and publish a VMware vCenter service design

Add the published design to the catalog

Approve a service request

Mark Tyler - Service Portal User/

Developer

Request for a cloud service offering from the Service Portal

Accept the cloud offering

The personas are limited to the above for this use case. However, you can configure different users to take up various responsibilities according to your requirement. For example, the DND administrator role can be further split into various roles like Service Designer and Catalog Administrator. For more information on roles and authorization, see Configure authorization for DND

Prerequisites

  • You have the Design and Deploy (DND) capability installed for Cloud Management. For more information on how to plan the system requirements, prepare the environment and install Cloud Management, see the Install section.
  • You need to deploy and enable OO capability before deploying DND capability. The installation of OO Containerized is mandatory for DND capability. 
  • Install VMware vCenter according to the manufacturer's recommendations. For example, follow the VMware best practices for managing individual ESX servers from a vCenter instance. You can find the VMware documentation at www.vmware.com.

Use case

Follow the below sections for detailed steps for configuring the product, publishing a VMware vCenter design, and requesting an offering from the Service Portal. 

Configure Suite Administration

Persona Location
Sandra - Suite Administrator Suite Administration Portal

Follow the below steps to create and configure a tenant with Design and Deploy (DND) capability.

Configure email 

Follow the below steps to configure the Email settings to receive notifications. 

  1. Access the suite administration portal with the URL in the format https://<hostname>/bo.
  2. Log in using the out-of-the-box suite administration user suite-admin. The password for suite-admin is set during the installation of the product.
  3. Go to Configurations > Email service. Enter the values for the following properties and select Test Connection.
    • Mail server host - SMTP hostname
    • SMTP server port - SMTP server port
    • Mail Protocol - Select Mail Protocol as SMTP
    • Certificate  - Select Plain
  4. Once Test Connection is successful, select Save.

Create Customer, Account, and Users 

A user is associated with an account which in turn is associated with a customer. Follow the below steps to create a customer, account, and user.

Create a customer

  1. Go to the Customers tab and select New. Fill in the following parameters and select Save to create a new customer.
    • Full name - VMware vCenter Offering
    • Short name - VMware

Create Account

  1. Go to Accounts and select New. Configure the following parameters and select Save to create a new account.
    • Shared Service type - Standard
    • Name - VMware vCenter Offering Account
    • DB user login identifier - Login Name
    • Customer - Select the customer (VMware vCenter Offering) created in the Create a customer section.

Create Users

After creating a customer and account, create the following users for this use case:

  • Mark - who will be Service Portal User
  • Oliver- who will be a tenant administrator
  • Ray - who will be a Design and Deploy (DND) administrator

Create an Operations Orchestration Administrator and a DND integration user.

  • OO_admin - Operations Orchestration administrator
  • DND_Integration_admin - Integration user
Mark - Service Portal user
  1. Go to Users and select New. Fill in the following details.
    • Account - Select the VMware vCenter Offering Account created earlier. 
    • Role - Select Account User
    • Login name - Mark
    • First name - Mark
    • Last name - Tyler
    • Email - Give a valid email address. 
    • Authentication type - DB
  1. Save the user details.
  2. On the user page, activate the user by selecting Active. 
  3. The user will receive a reset password link to the email ID configured while creating the user. Reset the password by accessing the link given in the mail. Don't set the password with a double-quote ("), forward-slash (/), or backslash (\) as these special characters aren't supported.
Oliver - Tenant administrator
  1. Go to Users and select New. Fill in the following details.
    • Account - Select the account created earlier
    • Role - Select Account User
    • Login name - Oliver
    • First name - Oliver
    • Last name - Twist
    • Email - Enter a valid email. A password reset link will be sent to this email address
    • Authentication type - DB
  1. Save the user details.
  2. On the user page, activate the user by selecting Active.
  3. The user will receive a reset password link to the email ID configured while creating the user. Reset the password by accessing the link given in the mail and following the instructions. Don't set the password with a double-quote ("), forward-slash (/), or backslash (\) as these special characters aren't supported.
Ray - DND Administrator
  1. Go to Users and select New. Fill in the following details.
    • Account - Select the account created earlier
    • Role - Select the value Account User
    • Login name - Ray
    • First name - Ray
    • Last name - Smith
    • Email -Enter a valid email. A password reset link will be sent to this email address
    • Authentication type - DB
  1. Save the user details.
  2. On the user page, activate the user by selecting Active. 
  3. The user will receive a reset password link to the email ID configured while creating the user. Reset the password by accessing the link given in the mail and following the instructions. Don't set the password with a double-quote ("), forward-slash (/), or backslash (\) as these special characters aren't supported.
DND_Integration_admin - DND integration user
  1. Go to Users and select New. Create an integration user by filling in all the details. 
    • Account - Select the account created earlier
    • Role - Select Integration User
    • Login name - DND_Integration_admin
    • First name - DND_Integration
    • Last name - admin
    • Email - Enter a valid email. A password reset link will be sent to this email address.
    • Authentication type - DB
  1. Save the user details.
  2. On the user page, activate the user by selecting Active.
  3. The user will receive a reset password link to the email ID configured while creating the user. Don't set the password with a double-quote ("), forward-slash (/), or backslash (\) as these special characters aren't supported.

Configure Cloud Management License

A Cloud Management license is needed to access the Cloud Management functionality. Follow the below steps to create a license.

Create a license

  1. Go to Licenses and select New.
  2. Fill in the following details and select Save.
    • Name - HCMX License1
    • Edition/License - Select Cloud Management as the license type.

Create a license pool

  1. Go to License-Pools > New.
  2. Fill in the following details and select Save.
    • Name - HCMX_Licensepool
    • Description

  

Add the license to the license pool

  1. Go to the license created earlier.

  2. In the License pool field, select the license pool created in the above section from the drop-down menu and save the changes.

Create and configure a tenant

You need to enable the DND capability on a tenant. Create a new tenant or enable DND on an existing tenant. The following section gives steps to create a new tenant and enable DND. If an existing tenant is being used make sure that the backend type of tenant is Service Management.

Create a Tenant

  1. Go to Tenant > New.

  2. Fill in the following details:

    • Account - Select the account (VMware vCenter Offering Account) created during account creation.

    • Backend type - Select Service Management.

    • Name - Give a name for the tenant. Example - DND_Tenant.

    • Type - Select the type of tenant.

Assign a tenant admin

Go to Tenants and select the tenant that you created. Select Oliver Twist as the tenant admin. Save the changes.


 
Assign a Cloud Management license to the tenant

Go to Tenants and select the tenant you have created. Go to Licenses > Add. Select the license pool that you created earlier and assign the license.

Deploy the tenant

  1. Go to Tenants and select the tenant you have created and select Deploy.
  2. In the Deploy tenant popup, select Deploy. This will start the deployment process.
  3. Check the status of the deployment in the Tenants page. On successful deployment, the tenant will become Active.

Deploy OO capability

The suite admin needs to deploy the OO capability on a tenant in Suite Administration before the tenant admin can integrate their Cloud Management system with Operations Orchestration Containerized or integrate it with Design and Deploy (DND). To deploy the OO capability on a tenant: 

  1. Log in to Suite Administration as suite-admin: https://<External Access Host>/bo.
  2. Click Tenants and then open the tenant.
  3. Select the Capability settings tab, and then click Deploy new capability.
  4. In the Capability field, select Operations Orchestration. 
  5. Enter the OO integration URL and OO login URL. For on-premises deployment, the OO integration URL and OO login URL are in the format https://<OO_HOST>:<OO_PORT>. For example, enter https://myoohost.example.com:9443 in both URL fields. 
  6. Click Next. The system starts the validation of the URLs you entered.
    • The URLs must start with https or http and mustn't contain a trailing slash (/).
    • The system can connect to the OO controller in the backend by using the OO integration URL you entered. 
  7. If the URLs have passed the validation, a note appears below the URLs, indicating that it's impossible to remove the OO capability once deployed. Select the checkbox for the note and then select Deploy. 
  8. The deployment starts. You can check the deployment progress on the Operation history tab of the tenant.
  9. Wait several minutes until the deployment is Done. 
  10. If the tenant admin has never logged in to the Agent interface, ask the tenant admin to log in: https://<External Access Host>/saw/dashboard?TENANTID=<Tenant ID>. This is because the system needs to replicate the relationship between the tenant admin user and the OO Administrators group from IdM to the Agent interface, and so you need to make sure that the tenant admin user already exists in the Agent interface. 
  11. Set Enable capability to On.
  12. Click Save.
     If the OO integration URL is invalid, an error occurs. Normally, this won't happen unless you have changed this URL by mistake after the previous URL validation in step 6. In this case, correct the wrong URL and then click Test Connection to validate this URL again and then click Save.

  13. As the tenant admin, check that the seeded roles and groups are replicated to the Agent interface: Roles (Administration > People > Roles): OO Administration Role and OO End User Role;  Groups (Administration > People > Groups): OO Administrators and OO End Users.

  14. Check that the tenant admin user is assigned to the OO Administrators group.

Assign OO license to the tenant

Associate OO license to your tenant as follows:

  1. Log on to the OO AutoPass License Server https://<OO_HOST>:<OO_PORT>/autopass.
  2. Click the CONFIGURATION menu, and then select the View option under the LICENSE submenu.
  3. On the VIEW tab, click the Select Product dropdown menu to choose Operations Orchestration.
  4. Select the License Feature checkbox and then click Assign. A popup dialog appears.
  5. In the Assign License dialog, notice the Select Product field auto populates the chosen product.
  6. Click the Select Tenant dropdown menu, and then select the applicable tenant ID from the displayed list. For example, 895955925.
  7. In the Capacity field, enter the desired license capacity for the tenant.
  8. Leave the Expiry Date field as is.
  9. Select Default Expiry Date checkbox. The predefined expiry date applies, and the Expiry Date field gets disabled.
  10. Click Submit. A popup dialog confirming the license applied on the tenant displays.
  11. Click Close.
  12. To verify the license applied on the tenant, select the TENANT tab.
  13. On the TENANT tab, click the Select Tenant dropdown menu and choose the tenant ID.
  14. Verify the details of the license applied.

Deploy DND capability

Follow the below steps to deploy the capability.

  1. Select the tenant and go to Capabilities Settings > Deploy new capability. A popup gets displayed.
  2. Select Design and Deploy and select Next.
  3. In the Config and deploy screen set the users as below:
    • DND administrator - Ray Smith
    • DND transport user - Admin, DND_Integration
  4.  Select the checkbox and select Deploy.
  1. The status of the tenant deployment can be seen in the Operations History tab.
  2. It will take some time for DND to be deployed successfully. Though the operation history indicates that DND is deployed successfully, the DND content installation may still be in progress.
  3. After the capability and content are deployed , go to  Capabilities Settings, and set the Enable capability toggle to On.
  4. The URL displayed in the tenant details screen is used to launch the Service portal for the tenant. 

Configure authorization for DND administrator

Create another user Ray who can be assigned as the DND administrator. Follow the below steps to create and authorize Ray to access DND menus and Data.

Authorize user as DND administrator in IDM

Persona Location
Oliver - Tenant Admin Service Management portal
  1. Log in to Agent interface as the tenant admin.
  2. Go to Administration > People > and select New.
  3. Enter the New person information
    1. First name - Ray
    2. Last name - Smith
    3. Name - Ray
  4. Select the checkbox against Create user.
  5. Enter a valid email. A password reset link will be sent to this email address.
  6. Save the page.
  7. Select the newly created user in the People page. 
  8. Under Group membership, select Assign to group. In the Add groups page, select the groups that you want this user to be a part of. For example, DND Administrators, Content Store Tenant Administrators, OO Administrators, OO End Users.
  9. Save the user details.
  10. The user will receive a reset password link to the email ID configured while creating the user. Reset the password by accessing the link given in the mail. Don't set the password with a double quote ("), forwardslash (/), or backslash (\) as these special characters aren't supported.

Configure user role for menu visibility

Persona Location
Oliver Twist - Tenant Administrator Service Management Portal

Follow the below steps to authorize Ray to access the Agent interface.

  1. Log in to Service Management as Oliver, navigate to Administration > People > ROLES.
  2. Select CMP Agent from the left pane.
  3. Verify that the following options are enabled . If not, enable the options and save.
    • General
      • Log in to the application
      • Permission to manage Service Design and Deployment
      • Permission to manage Operations Orchestration
    • Reports and View
      • Create public reports
      • Define schedule tasks for email reports
      •  Create public favorite views
    • Record Type
      • Service Definition - Create, view, and update are enabled
      • Provider - Create, view, update, and delete are enabled . If any of the options aren't visible, you can add it using   option.
    • Administration menu visibility
      • Ability to view all administration modules

  4. Do one of the following as needed:

    • Assign the CMP Agent role to the group that the DND user belongs to.
    • Assign the CMP Agent role to the DND user directly.
  5. Log in to Service Management as the DND user. The user now has proper rights to access the Build > Design and Run > Deployment Operations menu items. 

Follow the below steps to generate Key chain

  1. Launch the Service Portal using the tenant URL. 
  2. From the main menu, go to Administration > Application Settings.
  3. To create your tenant key chain:
    • Select Create key chain.
    • Type and confirm your Passcode. The passcode of the key chain must be 14 to 20 characters long containing at least one upper case character, at least one lower case character, and at least one number. 
    • Select OK.

Create and publish VMware vCenter Instance Cloud Offering 

Persona Location

Ray Smith - DND Administrator

Oliver Twist - Tenant Administrator

 Service Management Portal

Configure Application settings

  1. Log in to Service Management as the tenant admin.
  2. Select Agent Interface. This will take you to the Service Management portal.
  3. From the main menu, go to Administration > Application Settings. Verify the following options are set.
    • Experience mode - Add Cloud Management option.
    • Enable Service Design and Deployment - Set it to On.
    • Enable Aggregation - Set it to On

Add DND as aggregation Provider

Launch the Service Portal using the tenant URL and log in as the DND administrator. The user ID will be Ray and the password will be the one you had set while resetting the password. You need to add DND as an aggregation provider for the published design to be available for consumption. To add an aggregation provider:

  1. From the main menu, go to Administration > Providers > Aggregation Providers.
  2. Select New.
  3. On the New Provider page, fill in the following details and select Save.
Basic provider properties Title field Give a descriptive name for the new provider
Basic provider properties System type  Service Design and Deployment. After you select the System type, you will see the additional General and Integration user sections.
General URL

Type the URL of the provider system.
The URL must be https://itom-dnd-controller-svc:8444/dnd
Integration user Login name Give the DND integration user name DND_Integration
Integration user Password Give the DND integration user’s password

Install the latest capsule

To download the latest version of the VMware vCenter capsule, visit the ITOM Marketplace.

Install capsule using Content Store

Here are the steps to follow to install this capsule using Content Store:

  1. Visit the ITOM Marketplace.
  2. Download the capsule to your local file system. 
  3. Unzip the capsule file.
  4. Select    from the toolbar to start installing the capsule from your local file system. If capsule installation is successful, a tile for the respective capsule appears in the Content area. You can now start consuming the artifacts from the Cloud Management environment.

Install VMware vCenter

Install VMware vCenter according to the manufacturer's recommendations. For example, follow the VMware best practices for managing individual ESX servers from a vCenter instance. You can find the VMware documentation at http://www.vmware.com/support/pubs/.

Configure the content capsule

After you install the content capsule:

  • Configure the CSA OO Integration Content Pack (AFL) and the DND OO Integration Content Pack (CloudSlang) system properties in OO Central.
  • Create a resource provider.
  • You can see the VMware vCenter Compute - Deploy VM from Template (CloudSlang) service design under Service Designer.

Before you carry out the following tasks, set the required privileges/permissions for the Administrator role in VMware vCenter. 

Create a resource provider

In the Cloud Management environment, follow these steps to create a resource provider:

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface as an administrator.
  2. Go to Administration > Utilities > Providers > Deployment Resource Providers.
  3. Select the provider type from the panel on the left.
  4. Select the Gear icon   at the top right of the toolbar.
  5. Select Create Resource Provider.
  6. The Create Resource Provider window opens.
  7. Enter the Display Name.
  8. Enter the Service Access Point.
  9. Enter the User ID and Password in the respective fields.
  10. Select Create.

The Cloud Management platform creates the following provider:

  • Provider: VMWARE_VCENTER
  • Provider type: VMware vCenter
  • Service access point: https://<vCenter-Server>:443

Edit provider properties

Follow the steps to edit the provider properties:

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface as an administrator.
  2. Go to Administration > Utilities > Providers > Deployment Resource Providers.
  3. Select the provider type from the panel on the left.
  4. Select the Provider name.
  5. Select the Properties tab, you can see some provider properties. 
  6. Select the Gear icon   next to the property and select Edit.
  7. Edit the property values and select Save.

Configure OO system properties

  1. Go to AUTOMATION OPERATIONS > CONTENT MANAGEMENT > CONFIGURATION ITEMS.
  2. Configure the following OO system properties if required: OO_DND_PROXYHOST, OO_DND_PROXYPASSWORD, OO_DND_PROXYPORT, OO_DND_PROXYUSERNAME, and WORKER_GROUP; worker_group, x_509_host_name_verifier, trust_all_roots, trust_keystore, trust_password, proxy_host, proxy_password, proxy_port, proxy_username. Set the proxy properties only if your network configuration requires it.

Configure provider properties

  1. Go to Administration > Utilities > Providers > Deployment Resource Providers.
  2. Select the provider type from the panel on the left.
  3. Select the Provider name.
  4. Select the Properties tab.
  5. Configure the worker group property under provider properties.

Synchronize resources

This capsule uses the resource sync workflow from the OO Provider Resource Sync Content Pack. Resource synchronization fetches details about available resources for a given provider account. The resource synchronization happens automatically, via a scheduler, provided all the OOTB contents packs are installed during installation. This scheduler will automatically trigger the respective resource sync flow every 24 hours.

How is the resource synchronization time calculated? If, for example, the platform creates a scheduler on 19th March at 2:10 PM, then the first auto sync will happen 5 minutes later at 2:15 PM. Then on, the scheduler will run daily at 2:15 PM with no end date. 

To manually perform resource synchronization, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface as an administrator.
  2. Go to Administration > Utilities > Providers > Deployment Resource Providers.
  3. Select the provider type from the panel on the left.
  4. Select the Provider name.
  5. On the toolbar, select Resource Pools and then select Create.
  6. In the Create Resource Pool dialog box, enter the following details:
    • Display Name: vCenter Resource Sync
    • Known By Provider As: vCenter Resource Sync
    • Resource Synchronization Action: Click Select to select the Action vCenter Resource Sync.xml (Library/Integrations/Providers/VMware vCenter/vCenter Resource Sync.xml) from the option available.
  7. Select Create.
  8. Select the created resource pool.
  9. Select Synchronize option from the Gear icon  to start the synchronization process. 
  10. Monitor the Sync flow execution for successful completion in OO central. The platform updates the Last Synchronized Date under the Overview tab of the created resource pool. 

Associate resource offerings with the provider

You will see VMware vCenter Compute (CloudSlang) resource offering.

Follow the steps to make sure that the resource offerings are associated with the provider. If you add a provider after installing the capsule, then follow the same steps listed below to associate resource offerings with the provider.

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface as an administrator.
  2. Select My Dashboard  . Go to Administration > Utilities > Providers > Deployment Resource Providers.
  3. Select a provider from the list. 
  4. On the toolbar, select Resource Offerings. 
  5. On the Resource Offerings tab, use the Select button.
  6. On the Select resource offerings for the provider page, if the resource offerings are not associated with the provider, then you can see all available resource offerings on the left hand side. Select a resource offering and then add and save to associate resource offerings with the provider.
  7. If the resource offerings are associated with the provider, then you won't see any resource offerings listed on the left hand side.

Component templates

Following are the service component templates created based on CI Type system.

  • Server template: VMware vCenter Compute Server Template (CloudSlang)
  • Server group template :VMware vCenter Server Group Template (CloudSlang)

Publish a service design

Follow these steps to publish a service design:

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface as an administrator.
  2. Select My Dashboard  .
  3. Go to Build > Design > Service Designer.
  4. Search and select the appropriate service design from the designs listed in the All Designs area.
  5. Go to the Versions tab and select the copied service design version. 
  6. Select the Gear icon  and select Publish. A confirmation message appears.
  7. Select Yes to publish the design.

Create a service catalog

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface as an administrator.
  2. Select My Dashboard  .
  3. Go to Plan > Service Catalog > Catalog.
  4. Add a category or select an existing category in the Category pane.
  5. To add a category, select Add. The New Category dialog box opens.
  6. Enter a Display label (the name of the category).
  7. Enter a description of the category.
  8. Select a Background image, Background color, and Image, and enter a Display order and URL, as required.
  9. Select Save.

Add a service definition

The services associated with each category are listed under service definition. Follow the steps to add services to a category:

  1. On the Catalog tab, select the required category to add services to it.
  2. In the Service Definition pane, select Add.
  3. In the New Service Definition dialog box, select Create New to define a new service.
  4. Enter a Display label for the service.
  5. Select the Subtype from the drop-down menu.
  6. Enter the Description and save the changes.
  7. Go to the service definition that's created.
  8. On the Service Definitions page, select Build and then Save to build the service definition.
  9. Select Operate and then Save. When the service definition is in the Operate phase, the definition is operational and available to the end user.

Add an aggregated offering

  1. On the Catalog tab, select a service definition to add offerings under it.
  2. In the Offerings pane, select Add. Select Add an aggregated offering from the drop-down menu. 
  3. In the New Aggregated Offering dialog box, select a service provider and then select a service from the provider.
  4. Select Next and define a Display Label for the offering.
  5. Save the changes.
  6. To activate the offering, select the offering and select Activate. Activating an offering makes it available in the Service Portal.

Subscribe to a service

Persona Location
Mark Tyler - Service Portal User  Service Portal

After the aggregated offering gets activated, you can subscribe to it from the Service Portal.

Create subscription

Follow the steps to subscribe to the service:

  1. Log in to the Service Portal.
  2. Select the activated offering.
  3. Select Request.
  4. Fill in the required Request Details: Business justification and Start date and End date of the subscription.
  5. Enter the required values for subscriber options in the respective fields.
  6. Select Submit to complete the subscription process.

The Service Portal creates the request and assigns a request number. The service desk will then assign your request to the respective group to handle your request. You can track your requests on the service portal in the Requests tab. Select the request to see if your subscription is active.

Approve the service request

Persona Location
Ray Smith - DND Administrator Service Management Portal

To approve the service request, follow the below steps:

  1. From the Main menu, go to Run > Service Request. 
  2. Select the service request from the list.
  3. Fill in the following details on the service request details page
    • Current assignment
    • Service desk group
    • Owner
  1. After the assignment is complete, the service request fulfillment will start. Wait for the fulfillment to get completed. Refresh to see a notice indicating that a notification is sent to the user for acceptance. Once the fulfillment process starts the DND administrator can monitor the status of the deployment on the Instance Management page.

View the status in Deployment Operations

To see the status of the request in Deployment Operations. 

  1. In the Service Management Portal, from the main menu go to Administration > Deployment Operations > Instance Management.
  2. View the status of the service request. Once the service request is fulfilled , the service instance will be in active state.

View service request details and accept the solution

Persona Location
Eve - Service Portal User Service Portal

Accept the solution

On the successful fulfillment of the Service Request, a notification will be sent to Eve for accepting the solution offered.

Go to the Service Portal as Eve and accept the offering.

View subscription details

View the status of the request in the Service Portal.

  1. In the Service Portal, go to Your Request. Select the service request submitted to see the status of the request.
  2. To get the details of the subscription created go to Service Portal > Service and Assets.
  3. On the Subscriptions tab, select the subscription and select Actions.
  4. Select Manage service instance from the drop-down menu.
  5. Select the required component template.
  6. Select Actions and choose actions from the drop-down menu.
  7. Select Execute.
  8. The instance is provisioned and is ready for use.

Related topics

  • For more details about VMware vCenter capsule, see ITOM Marketplace
  • To know more about automatic resource synchronization, see Automatic resource synchronization.
